canThingFit

public bool canThingFit( Rect* r, int x, int y );
determins whether something can fit in the world without hitting anything else. Seems to check only Z's 5-9?
Returns:
true if there is nothing in the way

computeMovement

public bool computeMovement( Rect* thingRect, int startX, int startY, int destX, int destY, int& endX, int& endY );

adjusts a Rect so that it is completely in the world.

getByRect

public int getByRect( Rect r, Thing** array, int max, bool ignoreZ0 = false );
finds all the Things in the world bounded by a rectangle
Parameters:
r - the Rect
max - the maximun number of things to return
ignoreZ0 - true to ignore things at Z order zero (the background)
Returns:
number of Things returned in array

getByRect

public int getByRect( Rect r, Thing** array, int max, int minZ = 0, int maxZ = 15 );
finds all the Things in the world bounded by a rectangle
Parameters:
r - the Rect
max - the maximun number of things to return
minZ - the base Z order to start search
maxZ - the maximum Z to search
Returns:
number of THings in the rect. This number may be more than max, in which case the array doesn't contain all the things

movingThingAt

public Thing* movingThingAt( int x, int y );
finds the Thing in the Moving collection lacated at a point. The point passed in is reletive to the world canvas this worls live in.
Parameters:
x - the screen location
y - the screen location
Returns:
a thing from that location or 0 if non found

organizes the data structures to allow searching for things by location quicker
